Class UDPTransportConnection

public class UDPTransportConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements IIPTransportConnection

Implements a transport connection using UDP/IP.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

Method Detail

init

public void init(GUID d,
                 java.net.InetAddress a,
                 int p,
                 TypedMap opts)
Description copied from interface: IIPTransportConnection
Called by the service during connection setup to provide information about the peer. Issues with this method: - nodeId should be stored in the route, not in the connection. - addr and port are sometimes initialized through constructors and sometimes via this method. There should only be one way to do it. - Many options are written to the route object by code in the connection implementation. This is pointless. The service should directly write these options to the route.

Specified by:
init in interface IIPTransportConnection
Parameters:
d - node ID of the peer
a - remote internet address
p - remote port number
opts - a map containing optional information

getMetric

public int getMetric()
Returns the metric value of this connection. The routing service always trys to use the connection with the lowest value. This method always returns a valid value. If the connection is closed, the returned value is as if the connection were open (or only minimally different).
MetricDescription
9Connections to 127.0.0.1:PRIMARY_PORT. Because connections to the primary port never time out, they should always be used for data transfers when they are present.
10Connections to 127.0.0.1. Connections via the loopback network interface are cheaper than real network connections.
20Network connections.
999If the connection object has not been initialized with the address of the remote endpoint.

Specified by:
getMetric in interface ITransportConnection
Returns:
the metric value.
